column4: is there a way to upgrade openoffice1.x to 2.x or should i remove and install it?
so just apt-get 2 and hope its overrides 1?
OOo 1 and 2 coexist peacefully in breezy.
i just want 2 :)
I second doubletwist
and doubletwist thank you for your wisdom :)
i dont know how to see msg iam using irssi
one partition at a time, with 'sudo mount /dev/hda1 /mnt' with /dev/hda1 being the partition device name
do you want to see what filesystem is on a partition, or whether it is corrupted?
what type it is
because i have a harddrive but i dont think its ntfs or vfat or ext*
sudo fdisk -l /dev/hda
SFS file system...
u know if linux can write to sfs?
I don't think it can
can you try mounting it with -t ntfs pls
i have it mounted w. ntfs but that disables me from writing to it.. so i want to use ntfs-3f
that pretty much clarifies that you don't have a SFS filesystem. It's just labelled as such.
have you used ntfs-3g before?
yesterday at a friends house
i mounted a NTFS harddisk for him using ntfs-3g
so do the same to your pseudo-SFS now.
yah that is what iam going to do now, i was just confused about the SFS
